name: RetrieveFileThumbnail
description:
Retrieves a thumbnail image of a specified file.

This tool retrieves a thumbnail of a file in various sizes, such as 32x32, 64x64, 128x128, and 256x256 in .png format, or 32x32, 160x160, and 320x320 in .jpg format. Use this tool to get a smaller image representation of images and videos.

parameters.name: file_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the file. You can find this ID in the file URL on the Box web application.

value_schema.description:
The unique identifier that represents a file.

The ID for any file can be determined
by visiting a file in the web application
and copying the ID from the URL. For example,
for the URL `https://*.app.box.com/files/123`
the `file_id` is `123`.

parameters.name: thumbnail_file_format
parameters.description: Specify the file format for the thumbnail, either 'png' or 'jpg'.

value_schema.description: The file format for the thumbnail.

parameters.name: minimum_thumbnail_height
parameters.description: Specify the minimum height for the thumbnail image required. Accepts an integer value.

value_schema.description: The minimum height of the thumbnail.

parameters.name: minimum_thumbnail_width
parameters.description: The minimum width of the thumbnail to be retrieved. Specify an integer value.

value_schema.description: The minimum width of the thumbnail.

parameters.name: maximum_thumbnail_height
parameters.description: The maximum height of the thumbnail in pixels. Valid values depend on the specified format. For .png, maximum is 256; for .jpg, maximum is 320.

value_schema.description: The maximum height of the thumbnail.

parameters.name: maximum_thumbnail_width
parameters.description: The maximum width for the thumbnail image in pixels. Define the width according to the available sizes in .png or .jpg formats.

value_schema.description: The maximum width of the thumbnail.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the box API.

parameters.name: min_height
parameters.description: The minimum height of the thumbnail.

value_schema.description: The minimum height of the thumbnail.

parameters.name: min_width
parameters.description: The minimum width of the thumbnail.

value_schema.description: The minimum width of the thumbnail.

parameters.name: max_height
parameters.description: The maximum height of the thumbnail.

value_schema.description: The maximum height of the thumbnail.

parameters.name: max_width
parameters.description: The maximum width of the thumbnail.

value_schema.description: The maximum width of the thumbnail.

parameters.name: file_id
parameters.description:
The unique identifier that represents a file.

The ID for any file can be determined
by visiting a file in the web application
and copying the ID from the URL. For example,
for the URL `https://*.app.box.com/files/123`
the `file_id` is `123`.

value_schema.description:
The unique identifier that represents a file.

The ID for any file can be determined
by visiting a file in the web application
and copying the ID from the URL. For example,
for the URL `https://*.app.box.com/files/123`
the `file_id` is `123`.

parameters.name: extension
parameters.description: The file format for the thumbnail.

value_schema.description: The file format for the thumbnail.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
